intro: Litosanthes brauniana, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It is characterized by its unique, hairy leaves and striking, showy flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh conditions. Its root system is specialized for water retention, allowing it to survive in nutrient-poor soils. Litosanthes brauniana is considered a rare and endemic species, making it a subject of interest in botanical research.
